alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Chester; Crockett; Decatur; Gibson; Henderson; Henry; Madison (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:02PM CDT until July 18 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT FOR CROCKETT...HENDERSON...GIBSON...BENTON...CARROLL...MADISON... SOUTHEASTERN HENRY...CHESTER AND DECATUR COUNTIES... At 301 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Waverly to near Parkers Crossroads to near Fairview, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 300 PM CDT, trained spotters reported numerous trees down across Carroll County. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Humboldt, Milan, Lexington, Henderson, McKenzie, Trenton, Huntingdon, Camden, Natchez Trace State Park, Chickasaw State Park, Natchez Trace State Forest, Fairview, Alamo, Bells, Parsons, New Johnsonville, Three Way, Bruceton and Bradford. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Carroll; Chester; Crockett; Decatur; Gibson; Henderson; Henry; Madison
